attributes.action: Award a Knighthood to one of Britain's stars of the Golfing World
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
One of the following should be awarded a Knighthood to recognise their major contribution to world golf.

Peter Alliss is a  British golf commentator  of  worldwide fame and represented his country as a player in numerous Ryder Cup matches against the United States before turning his immense verbal talent to golf commentary for over 30 years.

Tony Jacklin  is categorised as the godfather of the modern game of golf. He helped to raise the stature of the European Tour and was inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame in 2002. He  won the British Open in 1969 and then won the US Open the following year – the ONLY Briton to have ever won the latter trophy.  He then went on to transform the fortunes of the , now European , Ryder Cup side leading them to a narrow defeat in 1983 but then winning in 1995 and again in 1997. 

Nick Faldo , is the greatest world-class golfer this country , or Europe , has ever produced.  He won six majors and was instrumental in the transformation of the European Ryder Cup team’s performances in the 1980s and 1990s. He has done much to promote the game of golf amongst youngsters with the creation of his Golf Institute.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.honours.gov.uk/
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
